articles.author: MICHAEL R. SISAK
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Donald Trump’s lawyers asked a New York appeals court Friday to halt his Manhattan civil fraud trial while they fight a court ruling that calls for dissolving companies that control some of the former president’s most prized assets, including Trump Tower.
articles.title: Donald Trump’s lawyers seek to halt civil fraud trial and block ruling disrupting real estate empire

articles.author: CHRISTOPHER RUGABER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The nation’s employers added 336,000 jobs in September, an unexpectedly robust gain and the largest monthly rise since January, evidence that many companies remain confident enough to keep hiring despite high interest rates and a hazy outlook for the economy.
articles.title: US employers added a surprisingly strong 336,000 jobs in September in a sign of economic resilience

articles.author: JON GAMBRELL, JOHN LEICESTER and ELENA BECATOROS
articles.description: Imprisoned Iranian activist Narges Mohammadi won the Nobel Peace Prize on Friday in recognition of her tireless campaigning for women’s rights and democracy, and against the death penalty.
articles.title: Jailed Iranian activist Narges Mohammadi wins the Nobel Peace Prize for fighting women's oppression

articles.author: HANNA ARHIROVA
articles.description: KHARKIV, Ukraine (AP) — A Russian missile attack killed a 10-year-old boy and his grandmother Friday in the northeastern Ukrainian city of Kharkiv, officials said. Elsewhere in the region, villagers prepared to bury their dead after a strike the previous day killed at least 52 civilians in one of the deadliest attacks in the war in months.
articles.title: A Russian missile attack in eastern Ukraine kills a 10-year-old boy and his grandmother

articles.author: STEVE KARNOWSKI
articles.description: MINNEAPOLIS (AP) — Attorneys who've been defending MyPillow chief executive and election denier Mike Lindell against defamation lawsuits by voting machine companies are seeking court permission to quit, saying he owes them unspecified millions of dollars and can't pay the millions more that he'll owe in legal expenses going forward.
articles.title: Lawyers say election denier and 'MyPillow Guy' Mike Lindell is out of money, can't pay legal bills

articles.author: JESSE BEDAYN
articles.description: CAÑON CITY, Colo. (AP) — Police said Friday they have found at least 115 bodies at Colorado ‘green’ funeral home under investigation for improper handling of remains. Fremont County Sheriff Allen Cooper said they are coordinating with other agencies to determine if there is any wrongdoing.
articles.title: Police find at least 115 bodies at Colorado ‘green’ funeral home under investigation

articles.author: RIO YAMAT and JOHN ANTCZAK
articles.description: LAS VEGAS (AP) — The man charged with murder in the 1996 killing of Tupac Shakur had little to say when he was arrested outside Las Vegas.
articles.title: Police bodycam video shows arrest of suspect in 1996 killing of Tupac Shakur

articles.author: TOM KRISHER
articles.description: DETROIT (AP) — The United Auto Workers union said Friday it will not expand its strikes against Detroit's three automakers after General Motors made a breakthrough concession on unionizing electric vehicle battery plants.
articles.title: Auto workers stop expanding strikes against Detroit Three after GM makes battery plant concession

articles.author: MARCIA DUNN
articles.description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla. (AP) — Amazon launched the first test satellites for its planned internet service on Friday as a rival to SpaceX’s broadband network.
articles.title: Amazon launches test satellites for its planned internet service to compete with SpaceX

articles.author: HOWARD FENDRICH
articles.description: Eager as the National Football League has been to cater to the recent public fixation with Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce, it’s certainly not taking any credit for creating the outsized storyline that has emerged around the pop superstar and the Kansas City Chiefs tight end.
articles.title: Can a spotlight on Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce help the NFL draw more Gen Z and female fans?
